Review Title: Not impressive and got cheated on prices that were confirmed in writing by the hotel!!
Review Text: Stayed 6 nights at the hotel for attending a course. Good room, but the placement of the bed was just across the AC with no way to reduce the AC fan. Bathroom needed a bit of maintenance. All in all room was not bad, but the wifi was extremely poor. Had power failures a few times but the generator was switched on quite quickly. Restaurant was very poor, although the food was good it took about 2 hours to get your burger or salad. But once I found jam at the breakfast buffet that had expired over 15 months ago I was not sure what I was ordering and eating was even fresh or not. I did get stomach issues when I stayed there. The hotel overcharges for everything!!! a bottle of water costs 100 outside but 1000 in the hotel. Food is extremely overpriced and conversion rates are also
Room Tips: Do not rely on the gym. Take USD cash or better yet Naira to avoid outrageous rates.

Review Text: The rooms are spacious and clean.  Several of the bathrooms require maintenance with either broken fittings or cracked tiles, panels etc. each room has very large pieces of art on display which vary from pleasing to downright scary depending on which room you get.  The restaurant is where things really go wrong.  Items not available, food preparation taking nearly two hours, food not being served at the same time for groups and the exorbitant pricing vs quality, all add to the disappointment.  The failure of the restaurant is really a pity as it detracts from what would otherwise be a 4 star rating.

Review Title: Quality of facility is fast waning.
Review Text: I'm currently here for three nights for a training. This facility has a lot of potentials and looks a lot like what I have seen in the Western world. However many parts of of it have been left without maintenance over the years. The gym has broken down equipment that have not been fixed over time. The wifi keeps throwing security errors, I had to make use of my personal wifi to be safe. My room kept making a beeping sound every 15 mins. Some of the staff act unprofessional and poorly trained. A little tweak here and there and they will back to 4 star. I'll pick this spot over intercontinental, Victoria Island or Sheraton, Ikeja any day.

Review Title: OKAY FOR BUSINESS VISIT AND SHORT STAY
Review Text: The service at Elion house is what is always so pleasant. The staff are always wearing a smile and are ready to go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable.  I am always happy with my stay in Elion house. The rooms are cosy and clean, their meals are okay as you will always find something good to eat on the menu or at the buffet table..  The gymn and pool are small and their design/location puts one in full view of any guests passing that way.  For the gymn I recommend they cover the glass (with curtain/paper) so the users have some privacy

Review Title: DELIGHTFUL STAY AT THE ELION HOUSE
Review Text: My first stay at the Elion House was in 2009 on business trip, and I was really impressed that the Hotel was able to maintain and sustain their services during my second stay in 2016 which was a family trip. The rooms are very cosy and quiet, the Internet is very fast and stable. I was offered complimentary breakfast buffet, I would definitely be returning to the Elion House Hotel. It was a "Home away from Home".
Room Tips: The Rooms that are reserved for their Oil Company clientel are much better.

Review Title: A bit of house, A bit of Hotel
Review Text: The positive and the nagative aspects of the property can be attributed to its 'positioning'. They want to be called a hotel and a house. True to the name - the food, the interiors, the pool, the facilities were just like a house. Offering everything basic to feel like home or guesthouse. However, the charm of hotel was missing. The place is centrally located both for mainland and VI visitors but no shops around. Ok for short stays.

Interestingly, all the staff here were very polite and friendly. Willing to go an extra mile to assist. Wonderful cooking/meals.  Secure environment, if you have business within the Ikoyi neighbourhood and want a quiet place in the city. This hotel is an excellent option as the food makes it feel like home away from home.  Though water had a bit too much chlorine.  Overall I would recommend highly.

my stay at ellion house was awesome. wonderful location, good room service, meals were ready on time and the staff were polite and helpful. There was no problem at all during my stay here. i will recommend

Review Title: Dirty bathrooms;  service slower than an arthritic tortoise.
Review Text: We stayed here for one night as it was closer to the conference venue we were visiting the next night.  Initially our impressions were that it was a beautiful venue with a great pool and friendly staff.  This impression was quickly dispersed by waiting over an hour and a half for dinner.  We had called ahead to check that the kitchens were open and were extremely disappointed to have to wait for such a long time (we ate at 11.30).  The food when it did arrive was poor and that is a charitable description.    Rooms were tired,  The bathrooms in most of our groups' rooms were covered in black mould.  My room had dirty fingerprints on the back of the pull out mirror, a feral air con that completely ignored the increasingly desperate commands from the handheld remote and a green

Frist of all the Spa is a massage room! I got to the Spa door and tried to enter, thinking I would meet the receptionist and secure a spa time, i actually thought  it was a normal spa only for the staff to come out and ask me "why i did not knock to go inside and thank God she locked the door because she was with a customer inside".  I was shocked and confused. I said i had no idea, there was no sign like " knock before you enter", "busy with a client" etc.  She said "still you have to knock to enter that is the right thing to do". I said "No people dnt knock to go into spa`s, it is like knocking before you go into a resturant or hotel!!!" Then she goes "I am keeping her outside, she has a client waiting for her inside, what can she do for me?" I told her I wanted to wax my
Review Text

The rooms in the hotel are medium sized, not very spacious but comfortable. I stayed in 3 rooms over the course of my staggered stay there. In each of these rooms, the bed mattress had sunk and was quite uncomfortable.   The bathrooms were pretty good and well maintained. The food on offer had quite a decent variety for vegetarians too. However, the breakfast was a huge disappointment. Virtually nothing good for vegetarians and hardly any variety. Service standards are okayish. Free Wi-Fi is provided.

Review Title: Perfect and very clean, well secured Hotel in Lagos, Nigeria !
Review Text: We recently spent a bit over one week in this hotel, I can say it was my best experience in an Lagos Hotel so far ( and I´ve been  staying in many different hotels in Lagos in the last 15 years). The managment is really doing all they can, to make it a nice experience for any guest. The breakfast offers almost anything you like, from warm to cold food, there is nigerian food (for example rice, yam or plantane with different stews) for breakfast, but also the european type... you can choose from different croissants, bread,cake or cookies, marmelade, fresh fruit salad, vegetables, sausages, different sorts of eggs, baked beans, fruit juice and so much more. The room we had was spacious and very, very clean. Flatscreen tv offered many national and international channels,

This is a strange hotel tucked away in a residential estate. The rooms are ok and the people seemed nice if not overly attentive. The standout feature is the food for al the wrong reasons. Lagos used to be a city of legendary poor value in accommodation and especially famous for trademark blue eggs and generally horrible food. In recent years things have changed with some good quality new hotels moving the game on and it's now possible to have a world standard breakfast and a good dinner in Lagos. Just not at this place.Powder coffee and generally a total lack of fresh and tasty food makes this a throwback to the bad old days of Lagos where a stale roll was as good as it got. I really struggled to find anything but bread to eat for my two days there and the usually pretty

I was again at Elion House Hotel last month for a week long day programme. The conference facility was excellent as usual and technical support was always available. I was particularly impressed with the countenance of the Chef on a particular day a colleague has a minor complaint. Subsequently, lunch served was top notch and the staff always had a smile to offer.

I came to stay a night before going to the US embassy for my Visa interview. I planned the leave the hotel by 05.30 am to beat the traffic and instructed the staff 3 times to provide my breakfast and lunch as take-away by 5.15 a.m. which was assured by all three of them. Surprisingly even till 05.40 a.m. no one turned-up and it's only I went down by 05.40 a.m. they started preparing it. For my shock, they brought my breakfast as a take-away  along with a glass of milk wrapped in a polythene for me to take away.  Also when I went to check-out I noted that no one has informed the front desk that i'm checking out, so wasted another 5 minutes there.  Staff in the restaurant were interested in what guests were talking and doing rather than doing there job. As shown in photographs,

Review Title: A well-hidden gem tucked away in a corner of Ikoyi
Review Text: This lovely bespoke hotel is hidden away in Dolphin Estate Extension, Ikoyi. Everything about it reeks of peace, calmness and pampering.  I was here for a week of an executive course. It is safe. The staff are courteous. The food is rich and well-prepared. The wifi fluctuate from average to very fast. The pool is neat. You can hang out at Sherlock's Bar or have a sumptuous meal at the Bistro.   If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Lagos without actually leaving Lagos, Elion House is a good hideaway. Joseph, Peter and Ugochi are their star staff. Ask for them, they will take care of you. Elion House also have a responsive maintenance team who are always ready to sort your room maintenance issues out.

This a hotel that knows how to take care of its guests they not only upgraded me into a suite but when they discovered I was staying for a longer period they immediately gave me a special scheme saving my money, the rooms are excellent and it's a perfect business hotel.

Our stay at the Elion House was awesome. Spa, swimming pool, Complimentary breakfasts. It was an experience I still look back on. Look out for package deals around holidays when they are most affordable.

Seldom do I get to try all of the elements of a hotel - health club, pool , restaurant , and bar ( in this case)  . As luck and the vagaries of travel in Lagos would have it, I had a chance to use all of the facilities of the Elion House a couple of times.   The result: the  facilities were all quite satisfying and made for a comfortable and relaxed place to stay (and hang out).  The room was clean and spacious.  The hot pepper soup with goat at the restaurant was delicious and the breakfasts in the bistro were quite good. The health club lacked for nothing in terms of work out options (pleasantly cooled in a hot hot place) and the pool was pleasant and well kept.  But what really made the experience considerably better than at some international chain hotel was the staff. They

December 2014 was my third visit to Elion House with my husband and still I was not disappointed. Great ambience, very courteous staff, clean and well maintained rooms, yummy meals.. it's home away from home.
Review Text

My stay @ Elion house was just two nights to celebrate the valentines day.  Very warm staff I must stay, the hotel was full to capacity but that's understandable considering the time of year.  Food portion was meagre, buffet breakfast wasnt so much of a buffet,  very limited. Pool looked small but actually has a massive deep end. I think that was okay....  The rooms were massive  ( largest i have seen in a while) very nice, I'll upload pictures in a bit.   Service was not very prompt though, food took forever to arrive and it came lukewarm but generally it was very serene  and nice.  I will return again.

My second time at the Elion House Hotel and it's still a great place to stay. Plus the pool has finally been fixed. The food is excellent and the service is courteous. Just the way I like my hotels -nice and quiet

Review Title: Nice Place, home away from home!
Review Text: I have spen a few nights at the Elion house twice. It's quite a nice place to stay away from the busy hustle and bustle in Lagos. The room are classic and the beds quite comfortable. The staff are very friendly and courteous. They even helped take care of the kids. The second time around though was that so pleasant for the kids because the pool was closed due to renovation and the kids wanted to SWIM! Please do plan your renovations when you have fewer guests especially not kids. Quite okay though for a place to spend some R n R.

Review Title: Quiet Hotel with no hope of disturbance
Review Text: Elion House is tucked away is a very secluded and quiet part of town. I believe security at the hotel is marvelous. Accessibility is however a problem if you do not own a car or cannot afford a cab. However, with the price range of the hotel, you should be able to afford a car or cab. Food at the hotel is very good and if you love arts, then you will like the decor. When next I want to hide from the bustles of Lagos, I'd simple escape to Elion House Hotel

I've been to Elion House Hotel, a couple of times this year for meetings. It's always been nice, food very good and the staff quite receptive. I'd recommend it for meetings as they always seemed prepared to receive their guests.

Needed a rest after a very hectic year and Elion house gave me that rest. Lovely rooms, nice and quiet environment, courteous staff and great food. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel's quality. My only critic? The pool was being renovated.

I needed to sit out with a lady friend of mine and I have always known Elion House to be the right spot for such time out. I didn't go there for the night but rather spent the time in the bar for a brunch and some drinks. They had great non-alcoholic drink variety and they ensured we were very comfortable with the r n b hits of the 90s. As you would imagine, she didn't just want to leave anymore. Okay, sandwich was rich but quite small. Service was top quality too. Security is definitely on point too..

It's a very good lebaniese hotel & it quiet hotel something near from the midtown - Good rooms area and form - the rooms are something expensive - The breakfast is very nice (lebanies food) - The internet connection is good - The pool is not big

the place is very secured inside a large compound away fro city center, food was average, rooms were good, neat and clean.  service was v. good and the staff were very welcoming.  place is very small, pool were v. small too, rate are average, while dinner were expensive. nothing to do there, not good place for families.

Review Title: Good hotel to stay in near to the island
Review Text: The hotel is conveniently located from the city centre in a quiet neighbourhood. The rooms are well-furnished and provides all the things that a business traveller would need. The amenities like swimming pool and gym are basic though and can be improved. The staff was polite and helpful. The food was average though and needs a lot of improvement.
Review Text

I stay at Elion House during the month of November 2012. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, Internet Wi-Fi in all rooms and fast connections. Food excellent and seems that the hotel keeps very high level of Hygiene.  Nice swimming pool and well equipped fitness center. Staff well trained.

Review Title: An oasis of calm in a sea of chaos
Review Text: This was my first trip to Nigeria to teach a class, and if there was one thing that greatly contributed to making it an enjoyable first experience in this country, it was this hotel. The only thing keeping it from earning an excellent rating is the very frequent power outages. The room was excellent, the service was great (though the rather abrupt style of communication of the Nigerians can be somewhat disconcerting), the 24 hour (!) room service was prompt and so was the laundry, and the food a bit pricey but excellent quality and quite a few choices from around the world. The bar is quiet. I spent all four days teaching in a meeting room at the hotel (a very large suite converted to a meeting room for the ocassion) and the conference services were also very good. The internet

Elion house is a calm place to spend the night. It is really far removed form the hustle and bustle of Lagos though these places are all accessible. Very polite staff, The toiletries need be upgraded though. Meal is ok, But i wouldnt say fantastic. Elion House is more to me like a good Bed and Breakfast hotel than a  standard 4star hotel

Review Title: Not bad as a business base
Review Text: I'm at  the Elion House as I type this review.  I'm here for another week and I'm staying on the second floor in the seperate block.  Overall, this is a very pleasant hotel.  It'd certainly be granted 3-stars if it were a UK hotel.  I find it difficult to accept that the hotel presents itself as 5-star.  Meal choices in the restaurant are limited, and I haven't established any kind of variation.  It's pretty much stew, rice and soup.  You can get other dishes from room service if 1) you're prepared to wait for at least 30 mins and 2) you like your dinner to be lukewarm.  Bedrooms and business facilities are great.  I feel very safe here.  Staff are very attentive.  Impressed that they referred  to me by name from the day I arrived.  The adventurer in me could resist the

It's impossible to find or say anything negative about this hotel. I arrived 5 days ago and will be here another couple of days - wish I could stay longer. The staff from the GM, and all his staff are the most professional I have encountered on my travels troughout Africa and the world. Nothing was hard to arrange, the service was excellent nowhere i have felt more at home. It was nice to see that the high customer service in this hotel has been maintained and that the staff members are as friendly and helpful as ever; from doorman to reception to security and restaurant staff: always a friendly word, a smile and attentive service.   You're greeted at check-in by professional and courteous staff who can't do enough to make check-in as pain free as possible. They ensure that your

The biggest concern for me travelling to Lagos was security and I felt secure in this hotel.   The room was nice: very large and had everything I needed. The shower was a little unpredictable - cold one day, scolding another and one day it didn't work at all.  The food was varied in quality - the breakfast was quite poor but the food in the bar was pretty good.   There were some issues with paying in advance of my stay but everything got ironed out when I arrived and they were apologetic about the issues.  I would stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying and working in Lagos.

Review Title: For me it is peacefull place in Lagos
Review Text: I have been 45 times and many different places in Nigeria in last 6 years. This hotel has different feelings for me. After long hours of work, hotel gives you peacefull times. It has much above qualit levels than other hotels in Lagos. Althouge it is in bit remote area but gives you time to relax. Also the staff is quite friendly and helpful.
Very bad location - recommended only if you want to avoid traffic of VI & Ikoyi . Rooms are small and charges very high.

Decent rooms in this Victoria Island hotel and modern, well kept bar/lobby areas.  Massive disappointment as usual in Nigeria is the service.  Absolutely diabolical - horrendous waits for anything you ask for even if you're the only guest there.  And, as usual everything is exceptionally overpriced so it receives a very low value rating.  I'd accept higher prices for imported goods but even a local bottle of water was near enough US$10.  Checking out is also a bit of a hassle.  Give yourself at least 30 minutes, again, even if you're the only guest.    Dont leave your luggage in their secure storage, last time it took quite a while to retrieve it and caused almighty delays with forward transport.  The place gets a recommendation purely because you need to stay here, and the
i visited this hotel that is located at a very isolated part of lagos, 5 minutes away from Victoria Island, where you get peace of mind away from the hectic environment...
Review Text

Stayed at Elion House for 8 days. Location: Lagos is a city of corrugated iron shacks mainly. This is not a disrespectful statement, but it is the truth - go and check if you do not believe me. Elion is in an area called Dolphin extension. It is in a compound, and the compound is on par with the poorer residential areas in any western country. Elion is owned by a Lebanese man who was born in Nigeria. Service; The staff are the most polite that I have encountered in all my travels. Room service average wait time is close to an hour. The hotel will sell you Naira currency for for N120 to the US dollar. Room pricing: most hotels in Lagos are more pricey than London, New York or Paris. At Elion, expect anything from $ 250 per room onward (corporate rate, that is!). Honestly, Elion

This hotel is very clean and rooms are reasonably well appointed, but I really struggle to terms with the price which is expensive.  Although often billed as a 5 star, it would probably only get a 3 start rating in Europe or the US. At around 270USD a night for the most basic room, it really is frightfully expensive and I did not get the impression at any time that it was good value for money. That said, the room (room 311) was clean ( albeit with a badly tiled shower and a shower curtain pole that kept falling down) and it had a safe and satellite tv. Security guards on the perimeter check all cars before entry (and this is a normal occurence in many hotels in Lagos). The block I stayed was in a separate block from the main hotel and so would entail a short walk without
